channel.title: Nokia E71
channel.description:
Are there any owners of the Nokia E71 here? I'm wondering about it's processing power, I mean sure I can read the specs. But in your opinion is it a powerful phone? I've heard rumors of being able to flash it with Windows Mobile 6.1, is there anyone here who can confirm this? There's supposed to be a new e series, called the E72, I haven't seen any pictures of it yet, but I may just wait and go with that phone.
I like the hardware behind the E71, I just can't stand the Symbian OS. If it is possible to flash the E71, it will be a definite purchase.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nokia_E71
EDIT: Went to the Nokia website, saw the E72, don't like it as much as the E71.

item.title: Nokia E71
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

The E71 is good, but if i were you i would get a Blackberry, they are much better and don’t crash like the symbian OS does. I have the Blackberry Bold 9000 and its a brilliant phone, my Dad has the E71 and is jelous of mine.

Read full topic

item.title: Nokia E71
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Thats supposed to be one of the best non touch screen phones ever made.

While s60 sucks for touchscreens, it is supposed to run awesomely on the nokia e71, so I recommend you get the phone and stick with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Nokia E71
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:290111”]Looks nice, When you consider the original IPhone has a similar processor that runs at 412 MHz (Just a bit more) So, logically I would think it is as capable as one.

However from what I have seen most Smart Phones running Windows Mobile Pro 6+ have a cpu running @ at least 400Mhz. You are stuck at 369 MHz.
Then again, I have seen a smartphone running Windows Mobile @ 200Mhz but on a Texas Instruments CPU.

You have a powerful phone, but not a powerful smartphone.[/quote]
WM6/.1 at 200mhz runs perfectly well, I had a T32 but it got stolen. WM 6.5 runs really well at at least 400MHZ and has good program performance(like games n shit) at 500+

Read full topic

item.title: Nokia E71
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Bloody hell, this thing is at least 100 times as better as my amstrad:

item.title: Nokia E71
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Looks nice, When you consider the original IPhone has a similar processor that runs at 412 MHz (Just a bit more) So, logically I would think it is as capable as one.

However from what I have seen most Smart Phones running Windows Mobile Pro 6+ have a cpu running @ at least 400Mhz. You are stuck at 369 MHz.
Then again, I have seen a smartphone running Windows Mobile @ 200Mhz but on a Texas Instruments CPU.

You have a powerful phone, but not a powerful smartphone.

Read full topic
